text_2.en: A button component in mobile UI development is an element that triggers an action when pressed.

text_5.en: A button typically adheres to guidelines such as elevation, shape, and color to convey interactivity. It serves as a touchable surface with discernible feedback, promoting a consistent and intuitive user experience across mobile applications. Add a button using the `addButton` method like this:

text_13.en: In case of `Upload`, you can specify `Multiple` to accept multiple files.

text_15.en: Here are the available setter and/or getter properties of the Button Component.

text_62.en: Here are the methods available for Button Component

text_65.en: Adds a callback function on right click.

text_76.en: Sets the size of the component.

text_99.en: Sets the x and y scaling of the component. This will ignore the positioning and flow of controls in the layout.

text_105.en: Returns the position of the component. The return object is of the form `{left, top, right, bottom}`

text_111.en: Sets the margin of the component.

text_120.en: Sets the padding of the component's container.

text_129.en: Sets the position of the component relative to its parent dimensions.

text_136.en: Sets the border line for the component container.

text_146.en: Sets the corner radius of the component.

text_155.en: Bring this component forward by a given z-index.

text_160.en: Bring this component backward by a given z-index.

text_164.en: Adds a callback handler when the button is touch. If the button is `toggleable` the first argument pass into the callback function is a `Boolean` value which is the active state of the button toggle.

text_168.en: Adds a callback handler when the button is long touch. The touch timer is about 500 milliseconds.

text_172.en: Sets a callback on file select.

text_176.en: Sets a tooltip when the button is hovered.

text_181.en: Sets a text-shadow to the button text.

text_188.en: Sets the padding of the button.

text_196.en: Sets the corner radius of the button.
